name: Juicy King Crab Express (19914Hollis Ave.)
address: 199-14 Hollis Ave, St. Albans, NY 11412, USA

reviews.text: I ordered the juicy king crab specialty and it was well worth the price. Taste was great and service was quick. The lady I spoke with over the phone was patient and explained to me what I would get with my order. Go ahead and place your order it is worth it.

The owners/employees were respectful & kind, I thank them for that. The restaurant is clean, the decorations are cute, & the service is efficient. The food is hit or miss. I ordered for a family dinner & it was all burnt, save the chicken & broccoli. That was the only dish that was delicious. Things were probably kept warm & torched to order. Very unfortunate food, good service.

My seafood boil ordered via uber eats was not good or appetizing at all! I‚Äôm trying to figure out how a meal can have so many different bad components I wasn‚Äôt able to eat the noodles or the sausage they were very salty, the lobster literally had no taste at all it taste like wet water I shakes the bag up before opening and still there was none of the sauce in the lobster shell when attempting to dip the lobster meat in the sauce, nothing but oil! Not butter oil! There is more oil than sauce the sauce already clings to noodles the shrimp not deveined as if I ordered head on. Waste of money! Never again!

Love it. The guy dishing out the food is cool .
The food was good and the atmosphere gave a sea üåä feel.

I order my food using an app. The popcorn shrimp was fresh and lightly battered. The hush puppies are tender inside and lightly fried crust on outside. Large portions. Comes with two separate sauces. One cocktail and one mild spicy.
I like the food !
I come in to buy every time I pass by here. The seafood here is very fresh and the staff in front are also very friendly.
Very valuable place, everything is fantastic. I will come back
Very nice place and the food is very fresh and tasty. I love it
Place needs to closed down! Salty, expired crabs and uncleaned shrimp!

I don't buy food from here as it is EXTREMELY expensive. But I buy the quart of sauce for $18 and buy my own seafood. The staff is nice and the place is always clean.

I saw this place and it had a grade pending sign but I was in the mood for seafood and besides my better judgement I got a boil the guy I noticed when it was too late didn‚Äôt wear any gloves while preparing my food he came out the rest room prior a day later I got food poisoning it‚Äôs day 2 and I‚Äôm still sick I would not recommend staff is rude as well

This is the first time ordering from here. I order calamari and dumplings. Omg the calamari was okay just had a funny a funny after taste even when I try drinking juice omg it was nasty don‚Äôt know I have had calamari many time never‚Ä¶

Really good food and good service, they always serve fresh foods

Ripped-Off At Hollis Ave Location. Owner Cheating It's Customers. I normally write glowing reviews, when the product or service deserves it. Not this time. Paid $20 for lobster salad, received 2.8 oz of lobster meat (I weighed it), when it should have been 6 oz. It was a lot of lettuce and tomatoes and an overcooked split hardboiled egg and very little lobster meat. My 5 fried oysters were actually 2 oysters cut into smaller pieces, and sold as 5 pieces. I spent almost $60 on this order. The food tasted good, but I was so disappointed in the portion sizes, that it ruined the entire experience for me. I ordered in person at the location and it was hand delivered to me, so it can't be blamed on any website, phone order or delivery driver issue. I'm insulted that they thought I wouldn't notice that I was being cheated.  But of course no one from this location will offer any restitution or even respond.to this review in a way that benefits ME. Thank goodness there are other Juicy King's in the area. Being penny wise and pound foolish isn't a good look for this company or their bank account,  because it drives customers away and directs them to another location, or a different franchise entirely.
Fantastic place, price $2 to$3 more than any other crab place.

Great customer service

Foods great,little expensive though..
There food is very good. Delicious!!!

I just came for the hush puppies. I'm vegan. Ordered some calamari for my mom. Hush puppies definitely were good!!
Very good.

Ordered the crab fries which is fries with a tablespoon of crabmeat on top and steamed scallops which were bite sized.  Wish there were more meat on the fries but what I paid for was not worth the price.
They gave so much food and it was delicious

This was my first time trying this spot out. I was not happy with my boil at all. I had a shrimp boil and the shrimp was overcooked and very dirty. I could barely separate the shell from the shrimp. I've been to plenty of seafood boil spots‚Ä¶

Very time gentlemen greeting me and assist me with my order. I orderd 2 shrimp boil with sausage. Fresh seafood and tasty but was seasoned with 2 much salt. The color of the food was bland not like saucy red as some I experienced. Fare price

Today is my second time ordering from Juicy King Crab Express in Hollis, Queens. The food is delicious and my order is delivered in no time.I ordered the Crab legs with corn and potatoes. I highly recommend you try their food.
I was looking for a good seafood spot in Queens. I ordered the snowed crab legs with sweet potatoe fries. It was very good and well packaged. I will be ordering from them again.
Food was delicious! Generous and big portions. Wait time was very brief! Great service. Will go back!
